definition: cautious and timid (idiom); prudent/careful
small/tiny/few/young
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
cautious/careful/solemnly/sincerely (formal)
careful/cautious

sentences.chinese: 然而，我們必須小心謹慎。

sentences.english: One must be very careful when comparing ORAC scores.
sentences.chinese: 在進行ORAC數據對比時，我們應該小心謹慎。

sentences.english: Another prejudice is the belief that policy should move cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 另一個偏見就是認爲制定政策應該小心謹慎。

sentences.english: It's strange how chary we are about praising.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是我們對待讚美非常小心謹慎。

sentences.english: On this matter, he is careful and fair-minded.
sentences.chinese: 在這件事上，他小心謹慎，公平持正。

sentences.english: He was a good and a careful driver.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個小心謹慎的好馭手。

sentences.english: They see you as very cautious, extremely careful, a slow and steady plodder.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲你非常小心謹慎，節奏緩慢但一貫辛勤。

sentences.english: Sadr's political comeback was the result of careful and deliberate planning.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克的政治復出是經過小心謹慎規劃的結果。

sentences.english: Don't be cagey or vague in headlines.
sentences.chinese: 不要在標題上小心謹慎和含糊不清。

sentences.english: He warned them to be careful and have a safe journey.
sentences.chinese: 他警告兩位新鹿王小心謹慎，以保旅程安全。

sentences.english: She is chary of lending money.
sentences.chinese: 她對借出金錢很小心謹慎。

sentences.english: When night cometh, then take I good care not to summon sleep.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚到臨，我要小心謹慎不去召喚睡眠。

sentences.english: It was careful to structure WaMu's sale so that it avoids a hit to the fund.
sentences.chinese: 華惠的出售要小心謹慎，以防止對這筆資金產生衝擊。

sentences.english: Unlike Utopia, Liu speaks in measured tones.
sentences.chinese: 和烏有之鄉不同，劉講起話來小心謹慎。

sentences.english: The girl is chary of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩對陌生人小心謹慎的。

sentences.english: We rely upon you to be careful in test-flying a plane .
sentences.chinese: 我們相信你們在試飛飛機時是小心謹慎的。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to turn a blind eye to
retort with challenging questions/debate
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
cavalier/offhand/reckless
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to advise
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to act blindly without thinking (idiom)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
idle gossip
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
